page.title: 14Amenities & Housing in Ripe
page.content: The centre of Ripe has all the main amenities, the main water was connected 20 years ago along with main drainage. The surrounding area is still on the waiting list for mains drainage. Electricity was installed in 1936 and pylons and poles were erected across the fields. Most houses are detached and have large gardens. {Listed Buildings} Ripe has many buildings of architechtural interest. The oldest building in the area is Chalvington Church, 13C. built by the order of monks at Michelham Priory. It is cemented with stone dressing and tiled roof. There is a chancel, nave with weather-boarded bellturret and a shingled spire. St. John the Baptist at Ripe is not so old and is depicted in the colour slide. It has Pelham tower & buckle, stone rubble tower.
